entry.title: Enhancements to Custom CDS Views Created Based on C-1 Released I_ProjectBillingElement View
entry.content:
This blog is relevant for you if you have custom CDS views that are based on the I_ProjectBillingElement (C-1 released) view.

Introduction

Core Data Services (CDS) is a pivotal technology in the SAP ecosystem, especially within SAP S/4HANA. CDS views are virtual data models that allow you to define and consume semantically rich data models directly on the database. They provide a powerful abstraction layer, enabling developers and business users to access, combine, and analyze data from multiple sources in a consistent and efficient manner.

CDS views are used extensively for reporting, analytics, and extending standard SAP applications without modifying the underlying codebase. They support advanced features such as associations, annotations, and access control, making them a cornerstone of modern SAP development and extensibility.

 

The Role of I_ProjectBillingElement 

Within SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the I_ProjectBillingElement CDS view is a released (C-1) interface view that contains details for the project billing elements. 

Many customers and partners create custom CDS views based on this standard view to tailor reporting and analytics to their specific business needs. However, as SAP continues to enhance its standard content for better performance and scalability, changes to these foundational views can sometimes introduce incompatible changes that require immediate attention from customers who have built custom extensions on top of them. In this blog, we will elaborate on incompatible changes to CDS views based on I_ProjectBillingElement and the required actions that need to be taken.

 

The Incompatible Change — Association Replacement in I_ProjectBillingElement 

With the release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602, we have made a significant change to the I_ProjectBillingElement view. The previously used _WBSElement association has been replaced with the _EnterpriseProjectElement association in the I_ProjectBillingElement DCL (data control language).
 
 
Business Impact 
 
If you do not adapt your custom CDS views by republishing them or by explicitly adding associations using developer extensibility tools, users will get unrestricted access to the data. Data control will not be applied correctly, and the system will ignore authorizations for users by default. Therefore, it is very critical to adapt your CDS views as soon as possible.

 
Why this change? 

The new association improves the performance of CDS views that are created based on I_ProjectBillingElement, ensuring faster data retrieval and better scalability for large datasets.

 

Immediate Action Required — Impact on Custom CDS Views 

If you have created custom CDS views based on I_ProjectBillingElement, these views are now referencing an updated association. This means that your custom CDS views may not function as expected until they are republished. Republishing ensures that all associations and DCLs are correctly created and exposed, aligning your custom views with the latest SAP enhancements.

 

Step-by-Step Process — How to Republish Your Custom CDS Views 
 
Scenario 1:  
CDS Views Created Using Key User Extensibility 

If you have created custom CDS views using key user extensibility, you must republish the topmost custom CDS view in your extension hierarchy. Here’s how:

  1. Log in as Extensibility Specialist. 
    Ensure you have the necessary authorizations to manage and publish custom CDS views.

  2. Navigate to the Custom CDS Views App in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system.

  3. Filter for high-priority tasks. Use the Task Priority filter to display tasks marked as High or Very High. These indicate CDS views that require immediate attention due to the underlying changes.

  4. From the list, select the topmost custom CDS view created based on I_ProjectBillingElement and navigate to the Details page of this custom CDS view.

    For example, if YY1_CDS1 is created based on I_ProjectBillingElement and YY1_CDS2 is created based on YY1_CDS1, then select YY1_CDS2 and perform the further steps. This ensures that all dependent views are updated at once.

  5. In the Custom CDS Views Detail page, click Tasks. You will see the tasks that you need to perform. 

  6. Click Edit.  

  7. Click the Publish button at the bottom-right corner of the screen. 
    The custom CDS views will be republished.  

Scenario 2:  
CDS Views Created Using Developer Extensibility Tools 

If you have created custom CDS views based on I_ProjectBillingElement in a 3-system landscape using developer extensibility tools, and if the custom views inherit the DCL from I_ProjectBillingElement DCL, then you need to manually add the association and the key for this association in your custom CDS views. This means that you need to explicitly expose _EnterpriseProjectElement association in every custom CDS view that inherits the DCL from I_ProjectBillingElement DCL. You also need to add the field ProjectElementUUID to extract data from _EnterpriseProjectElement association.

 

Why Is This Important? 

  • Performance: The new association (_EnterpriseProjectElement) is optimized for better performance, which can significantly improve reporting and analytics speed.

  • Compatibility: Republishing ensures your custom views remain compatible with the latest SAP standard content, preventing potential errors or data inconsistencies.

  • Future-Proofing: Keeping your custom extensions aligned with SAP’s ongoing enhancements reduces technical debt and simplifies future upgrades.

Conclusion 

Continuous innovation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition means that standard content, such as CDS views, will evolve for better performance and functionality. While these changes bring significant benefits, they also require customers to stay vigilant and proactive in maintaining their custom extensions.

If you have custom CDS views based on I_ProjectBillingElement, the immediate action required is to republish your topmost custom CDS views or expose the required association and field in your custom CDS views, as described above. This process ensures you benefit from SAP’s latest performance improvements and maintain a robust, future-ready analytics landscape.

By following the outlined steps, you can ensure your custom CDS views continue to deliver value without disruption, leveraging the full power of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition’s ever-evolving capabilities.

基于中国本地化的业务需求，为了不虚增科目余额表中的借贷发生额，SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition在 2508 版本推出了负过账清账功能，以满足中国客户对科目余额表的使用需求。

 

系统配置

激活国家/地区的负过账Activate Negative Posting for Country/Region (ID 107034)

***如果要为未启用未清项目管理的总账科目激活负过账，请选中无未清项目管理（W/o Opening Item Mng）复选框。否则，系统将仅针对已启用未清项目管理的总账科目激活负过账。

 

公司代码总账视图Company Code General Ledger View (ID 106039)

 

定义凭证类型Define Document Types (ID 101522)

 

 

系统功能效果

 

业务场景1 – 应收账款清账

1.1应收账款清账，当借方金额等于贷方金额

如果清算凭证的借方行项目总金额等于贷方行项目总金额，则系统会为贷方行项目设置负过账标识。

以确认应收账款381.60 CNY，实际收款 381.60 CNY为例，清算凭证的借方金额等于贷方金额。

应收账款的贷方正数金额在标记负过账之后转换成借方的负数金额执行过账。

 

1.2应收账款清账，当借方金额大于贷方金额

如果清算凭证的借方行项目总金额大于贷方行项目总金额，则系统会为贷方行项目设置负过账标识。

以确认应收账款381.60 CNY，实际收款 481.60 CNY为例，清算凭证的借方金额大于贷方金额。

 

1.2.1部分清账场景

在部分清账场景下，应收账款的贷方正数金额在标记负过账之后转换成借方的负数金额执行过账。

 

 

1.2.2剩余清账场景

在剩余清账场景下，应收账款的贷方正数金额在标记负过账之后转换成借方的负数金额执行过账。

 

 

 1.3 应收账款清账，当借方金额小于贷方金额

如果清算凭证的借方行项目总金额小于贷方行项目总金额，则系统会为借方行项目设置负过账标识。

以确认应收账款381.60 CNY，实际收款 281.60 CNY为例，清算凭证的借方金额小于贷方金额。

 

1.3.1部分清账场景

在部分清账场景下，应收账款的贷方正数金额在标记负过账之后转换为借方的负数金额执行过账。

 

 

1.3.1剩余清账场景

在剩余清账场景下，应收账款的借方正数金额在标记负过账之后转换为贷方的负数金额执行过账。

 

 

在剩余清账分录生成后，另有余额100.00 CNY 需执行后续清账， 当后续收款 100.00 CNY 完成后，可以再次就剩余项目执行清账，过账清算凭证。在剩余项目清账场景下，应收账款的贷方正数金额在标记负过账之后转换为借方的负数金额执行过账。当前剩余项目清账场景，也可以类比参考清算凭证的借方金额等于贷方金额的场景考虑。

 

 

 

 

 

业务场景2 – 应付账款清账

如果清算凭证的借方行项目总金额等于贷方行项目总金额，则系统会为贷方行项目设置负过账标识。

应付账款的贷方正数金额在标记负过账之后转换成借方的负数金额执行过账。

如果清算凭证借方行项目总金额大于贷方行项目总金额，则系统会为贷方行项目设置负过账标识。

以确认应付账款1,100 CNY，实际付款 1,000 CNY为例，清算凭证的借方金额大于贷方金额。

 

2.2.1部分清账场景

在部分清账场景下，应付账款的贷方正数金额在标记负过账之后转换成借方的负数金额执行过账。

 

 

2.2.2剩余清账场景

在剩余清账场景下，应付账款的贷方正数金额在标记负过账之后转换成借方的负数金额执行过账。

 

 

2.3 应付账款清账，当借方金额小于贷方金额

如果清算凭证的借方行项目总金额小于贷方行项目总金额，则系统会为借方行项目设置负过账标识。

以确认应付账款1,100 CNY，实际付款 1,200 CNY为例，清算凭证的借方金额小于贷方金额。

 

2.3.1部分清账场景

在部分清账场景下，应付账款的贷方正数金额在标记负过账之后转换成借方的负数金额执行过账。

 

 

2.3.2剩余清账场景

在剩余清账场景下，应付账款的借方正数金额在标记负过账之后转换成贷方的负数金额执行过账。

 

 

综上所述，如果清算凭证的借方总金额大于或等于贷方行项目的总金额，则系统会为贷方行项目设置负过账标识，意味着贷方行项目原本的正数金额会转换为借方行项目的负数金额过账；反之，如果清算凭证的借方总金额小于贷方总金额，在部分清账场景下，系统会为贷方行项目设置负过账标识，在剩余清账场景下，系统则会为借方行项目设置负过账标识，意味着借方行项目原本的正数金额会转换为贷方行项目的负数金额过账。

 

由于借方行项目或者贷方行项目以负数记账，与原本对方科目的正数行项目在同一边进行抵销，所以清算分录的借贷方发生额合计为零，在查看科目余额表时则不会造成借贷方发生额虚增的问题，从而影响财务分析。

 

不适用场景：

请注意，如果是不同的客户或者供应商之间的清算，或者是不同总账科目之前的清算，例如应收和应付的对清，目前都不适用于负过账清账功能。

entry.title: Tax-Included Sales Pricing in SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
China and Southeast Asian countries have a common practice of using tax-inclusive prices for sales inquiries and sales orders. However, existing systems typically distinguish only between net prices and tax amounts. This article explores in depth how to quickly implement this requirement through configuration alone—without writing any coding.

System Behaviour

After proper configuration, When I type the tax-included total amount 100 CNY in condition type ZLQ1 and press Enter,  Net price of condition type ZLQN will be calculated with the following logic:

netamount = grossamount/(1+taxrate)

in our case:

88.5 = 100/(1+13%)

Pleaes note,  we can see standard TTX1 as a comparison, the tax amount for TTX1 is 13 CNY (100 * 13%). With our customized condition type ZLQX (tax condition), tax amount is caulated as the correct 11.5 CNY (100 CNY/1.13).

Then how to achieve this, please go ahead with the following configuration steps.

Configuration

SSCUI 101120  Set Condition Types for Pricing in Sales

Create new condition type ZLQ1 – Tax-included Price

Create new condition type ZLQX – Tax rate

Please notice here the calculation type is H, while the calculation type of TTX1 is A. This is the key make the above tax amount calculation different.

Create new condition type ZLQN – net amount

SSCUI 101117 Set Pricing Procedures

Copy procedure Y1301 to new pricing procedure Z0002

Add the above newly created condition type to the pricing procedure as follows:

SSCUI 101118 Set Pricing Procedure Determination
